text:
Raise your hand if you've ever
been bitten by a mosquito.

To no surprise, almost every
hand in here has gone up,

and that would be
true whether we

are in Latin America,
sub-Saharan Africa,
or Southeast Asia.

For many people worldwide,
a simple insect bite

can be the difference
between life and death.

As a global health doctor,
I know that to be true.

I've seen children dying
needlessly from malaria.

I've seen patients suffering
from the bone breaking
pain of dengue fever.

I think all of us
have seen what happens

to the brains of children who
have suffered from the Zika
virus.
The problem is obvious.

Billions of dollars are
spent each year battling
insect borne illness.

And yet we still do not
have an effective solution

to protect people
away from the home.

Studies show that people
don't use current repellents,

because it smells bad,
it's sticky on the skin,

it uses toxic
ingredients like DEET.

Or they just have reapply
it once every three hours.

Well, at Hour 72 Plus, we
listen to these complaints,

and we developed a
repellant that's not sticky,

that doesn't smell, doesn't
use any toxic ingredients

like DEET, and it
maintains nearly 100%

efficacy for up to three days,
with just one application.

Hour 72 Plus is a revolution in
how we will protect ourselves
from insects.

It will benefit every
single person in this room,

and it will benefit billions
of the world's most vulnerable
people.
For us, it's exciting.

But for mosquitoes,
it's a buzz kill.
[APPLAUSE]
